paper_title.en: Phase transitions of the mixed system of (Rb1-xCsx)(2)ZnI4

description.en: The mixed system of (Rb1-xCsx)(2)ZnI4 was prepared over full range of x by Bridgman method and the phase transitional properties were investigated. The melting point T-m, alpha-beta phase transition point T alpha-beta and dielectric peak temperature T-C of both Rb2ZnI4 and Cs2ZnI4 were obtained as the function of x. Obtained results were discussed in connection with supecooling of alpha-beta phase transition.

paper_title.en: DSC, DTA and TG studies on structural phase transitions in Tl2ZnCl4

description.en: Among A(2)BX(4)-type compounds belonging to the pseudo-hexagonal beta-K2SO4 structure known to form incommensurate (IC) phases at low temperatures, the phase transition sequence in Tl2ZnCl4, where Rb+ ions in the representative compound Rb2ZnCl4 were substituted by T1(+) ions with a similar ionic radius, was investigated by the differential thermal analysis (DTA) and the differential scanning calorimetry (DSC). The composition of a hydrous compound which was obtained by keeping under the atmosphere was determined to be Tl(2)ZnCl(4)center dot 1.5H(2)O by the thermogravimetric (TG) analysis. (c) 2005 Elsevier B.V. All rights reserved.

The ferroelectric Rb2CdI4 shows the largest peak of the dielectric constant at the Curie point (T-C = 211 K) among the Ti2ZnI4 group ferroelectrics of Sr2GeS4-type crystal structure (monoclinic system). Furthermore, the shoulder-like anomaly in the dielectric constant of Rb2Cdl4, as for most ferroelectrics of this group, appears at the temperature (T-S = 150 K), which is lower by 50 degrees than T-C. In this research, thermal expansions of the crystal grown by the Bridgman method were measured in the temperature range from 4 K to 500 K by using a clip-type strain-gauge dilatometer. The feature of a second-order transition had appeared clearly at T-C = 211 K in thermal expansions x(i) (i = a*, b, and c; a* is perpendicular to the a-plane); however, anomalies were not seen clearly around the T-S.

publication_name.en: JOURNAL OF THE KOREAN PHYSICAL SOCIETY

paper_title.ja: Possible Existence of α-β Phase Transition in Tl2ZnCl4
paper_title.en: Possible existence of alpha-beta phase transition in Tl2ZnCl4

description.en: It was revealed that Bridgman crystals of TI2ZnCl4 have a supercooled state of the high-temperature beta-phase with orthorhombic beta-K2SO4 structure, as seen in TI2ZnI4 group substances. The original stable phase at room temperature is a-phase with monoclinic Sr2GeS4 Structure. The alpha-beta transition point exists around 340 K, and the phase-transition point was confirmed at 363 K in the beta-phase. Furthermore, on cooling, another phase transition point was confirmed at 173 K in the supercooled beta-phase.

publication_name.ja: Journal of the Korean Physical Society

paper_title.en: Dielectric properties of Rb2CdBr4 and Rb2HgBr4

description.en: Phase transitional properties of Rb2CdBr4 and Rb2HgBr4 were investigated. The differential thermal analysis for Rb2CdBr4 indicates the same supercooled nature of the phase transition as observed in A(2)BX(4)-type halides with the structure of Sr2GeS4-type. On the other hand, the temperature dependence of the dielectric constant of Rb(2)HgBr4 shows two anomalies at low temperatures, which are analogous to those of Cs2HgBr4 and Cs2ZnI4 with the structure of orthorhombic beta-K2SO4-type.

paper_title.en: Dielectric properties of Rb2CdBr4 and Rb2HgBr4

description.en: Phase transitional properties of Rb2CdBr4 and Rb2HgBr4 were investigated. The differential thermal analysis for Rb2CdBr4 indicates the same supercooled nature of the phase transition as observed in A(2)BX(4)-type halides with the structure of Sr2GeS4-type. On the other hand, the temperature dependence of the dielectric constant of Rb(2)HgBr4 shows two anomalies at low temperatures, which are analogous to those of Cs2HgBr4 and Cs2ZnI4 with the structure of orthorhombic beta-K2SO4-type.

paper_title.en: Dielectric properties of the mixed system of (Cs1-xRbx)(2)HgI4

description.en: The mixed system of (Cs1-xRbx)(2)HgI4 was prepared over full range of x by Bridgman method. Differential thermal analysis, dielectric constant measurement and D-E hysteresis loop observations were performed for the samples. It was turned out that alpha - beta transition point Talpha - beta disappears in the ratio of about x = 0.7 and the end member Rb2HgI4 has no alpha - beta transition point at high temperatures.

publication_name.en: JOURNAL OF THE KOREAN PHYSICAL SOCIETY

paper_title.en: Search for New Ferroelectrics in Tl_2ZnI_4 Group
Linear and volume thermal expansions of ferroelectric Rb2CoCl4

description.en: The linear thermal expansions x(i) (i = a, b, c) of ferroelectric Rb2CoCl4 single crystals were measured by means of a clip-type dilatometer using four strain gauge elements down to liquid helium temperature. Anomalous parts of the strains along the a - and b -directions appeared with opposite signs below the T-i . Anomalies along the pseudo-hexagonal c-directions are smaller than that along the other directions. The linear thermal expansion coefficients alpha(i) (i = a, b, c) showed anomalies at the successive phase transition temperatures T-C2 = 73.7 K, T-C1 = 198.3 K, T-i = 292.6 K in the heating process. Volume thermal expansion coefficient beta of this substance showed small anomaly even around each phase transition temperature but negative value below about 20 K.

Linear and volume thermal expansions of ferroelectric Rb2CoCl4

description.en: The linear thermal expansions x(i) (i = a, b, c) of ferroelectric Rb2CoCl4 single crystals were measured by means of a clip-type dilatometer using four strain gauge elements down to liquid helium temperature. Anomalous parts of the strains along the a - and b -directions appeared with opposite signs below the T-i . Anomalies along the pseudo-hexagonal c-directions are smaller than that along the other directions. The linear thermal expansion coefficients alpha(i) (i = a, b, c) showed anomalies at the successive phase transition temperatures T-C2 = 73.7 K, T-C1 = 198.3 K, T-i = 292.6 K in the heating process. Volume thermal expansion coefficient beta of this substance showed small anomaly even around each phase transition temperature but negative value below about 20 K.
